intro: [WRONG START] Walenia bumelioides, commonly known as the smoothleaf ironwood, is a shrub native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its dense, aromatic foliage and small, white to yellowish flowers that bloom in the spring. The plant has rough, fissured bark and is often found in rocky or gravelly soils. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is known for its hardiness in arid environments. The leaves are typically narrow and have a leathery texture, contributing to its drought tolerance.
